definition: thick/deep or profound/kind/generous/rich or strong in flavor/to favor/to stress

sentences.english: If you want to be a good salesman, you must be thick-skinned.
sentences.chinese: 如果你想要成为一个好的推销员，你一定要厚脸皮。

sentences.english: This is shameless, I know, but that’s part of the job. (Laughter.)
sentences.chinese: 我知道这有点厚脸皮，但这是我工作的一部分。

sentences.english: He said incident reports were filed but ignored by brass.
sentences.chinese: 他说事件报告已经存档了，但是被那些厚脸皮忽视了。

sentences.english: The foolhardy Zaarin even had the audacity to strike against the Emperor himself.
sentences.chinese: 有勇无谋的扎林甚至厚脸皮到了反击帝国的地步。

sentences.english: He's really a thick - skinned gate-crasher.
sentences.chinese: 他真是个厚脸皮的不速之客。

sentences.english: Being thick-skinned is necessary for a successful salesperson.
sentences.chinese: 一位成功的推销员所需要的就是厚脸皮。
他亦是一个厚脸皮的煽动家。

sentences.english: The brassy boys put their tongues out at us.
sentences.chinese: 那些厚脸皮的男孩儿朝着我们伸舌头。

sentences.english: There is no better time to develop some thick skin than after a rejection.
sentences.chinese: 被拒绝后是练就厚脸皮的最佳时机。

sentences.english: Muzzle moderately pointed, avoiding any tendency toward snipiness or cheekiness .
sentences.chinese: 口吻略微有点尖，不能象被截断的样子或厚脸皮。

definition: to have no sense of shame/shameless
to know no shame/to be totally shameless
to have no sense of shame
to act shamelessly/to behave in a way that leaves others tut-tutting and shaking their heads in disapproval
